p: This strategy comprises early diagnosis and immediate linkage to care. HIV testing is a gateway for both prevention and treatment. However, only 38.9% of the US population in 2016â€“2017 had ever been tested, including 46.9% in the 50 local jurisdictions and 35.5% in the 7 high rural burden states [ 59]. Although 86% of PWH across the United States were diagnosed, the biggest gaps in the prevalence-based HIV care continuum were linkage to and receipt of care (64%) and retention in care (49%) [ 60].
